benchmark_details.name: ODSum
benchmark_details.overview: ODSum is a novel dataset designed for Open-Domain Multi-Document Summarization (ODMDS) tasks, constructed from existing QMSum and SQuALITY datasets to better represent realistic querying needs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that reflects real-world challenges in retrieving and summarizing information across diverse document collections in ODMDS tasks.

data.source: Constructed from existing datasets SQuALITY and QMSum, along with a customized data collection pipeline.
data.size: 1,190 documents for ODSum-story, 232 documents for ODSum-meeting
data.annotation: Queries and summaries were generated and reviewed by multiple annotators for quality assurance.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on word overlap for ROUGE and BERTScore; G-E VAL uses a contextual scoring based on LLM outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better summarization quality, with G-E VAL providing a more nuanced evaluation of retrieval impact.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments comparing different retrieval and summarization strategies.
